website_summaries.verdict: Backpacking sleeping bag features integrated packing system and is easy to roll  up for storage. Great for camping in temperatures as low as 0 degrees Fahrenheit.
pros: Big and tall design can accommodate most people up to 6-foot 5-inches
Features warm cotton canvas cover, heat-locking flannel liner, and matching flannel pillow
Extra width makes it easy to sprawl out with the bag zipped
Perfect for unzipping and putting on top of a queen size bed
Doesn't have a slick or slippery outer covering
Comfy and cozy for cool nights
cons: May not be enough insulation in the middle for some
Won't fit inside a regular size washing machine to wash
Odd flap sewn above head could be annoying to some as it flaps in face when sleeping

customer_reviews.title: Description says " 100% Cotton with fill 100% Cotton " ...
customer_reviews.text: Description says " 100% Cotton with fill 100% Cotton ". but received filling with 100% Polyester!? I post the picture from the tag on the box.
customer_reviews.author: HAPPY JACK

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% Cotton
customer_reviews.text: It is too early to tell if I will like this bag or not. BUT, I am very disappointed with the FALSE information in the product description. I bought this bag because it was "100% Cotton fill 100% Cotton" even though I had misgivings because it was imported. It is NOT 100% cotton. Filing is 100% polyester as is 20% of the lining. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it's a nice bag, and I look forward to using it ...
customer_reviews.text: Liar liar pants on fire coleman! Not all cotton fill or all cotton anything for that matter, so bummed, please change the description it lies and makes me think your company is dishonest! Other than that it's a nice bag, and I look forward to using it camping, it is good quality for synthetic material, maybe I should have shelled out even more for the real thing elsewhere but I just cant justify spending more than a 100 bucks on a sleeping bag that I'll only use a few times a year. for the price I was expecting all cotton..
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: After airing the bag out for a day to get rid of the musty smell, the bag was warm and a good size.
customer_reviews.text: The bag came on time is the right size and fabric I ordered. It was in its original box which was completely worn out and wrapped around the bag, no tape left on it. The bag smells fine on the outside but musty on the inside. I have to take it to the laundromat because I need to use it in 2 days and cannot sleep in it with the musty odor. Update: I put the bag inside out and hung it outside. I spritz it with Essential Oil spray. It seemed to get rid of the smell. I'll update to 5 stars if it keeps me warm this weekend :) Updated after use: warm and a good size
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate sleeping bags. I usually take my down comforter camping with us but it just takes up so much room. So I opted to try a different sleeping bag. This one is amazing. It’s so soft inside and very padded. I used the little pillow between my legs but it’s not ideal for your head. It worked great though for what I needed it for. The zipper is hard to move cause the bag is so fluffy it gets snagged a bit. But overall I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Etienne

customer_reviews.title: Nice and BIG for the tall men out there!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6’4 so we needed sleeping bags to fit him. We like flannel sleeping bags to zip together so we can cozy up together. This bag does the trick. It’s so warm (we have only camped in Southern California at the beach in the summer and fall) we don’t need any other blankets. The only weird thing about this is the sewed on flap that is used to keep it secure after it’s rolled up will be in someone’s face anytime we zip these together. It would be better if that flap was sewed onto the foot of the bag instead of the top of it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenpco

customer_reviews.title: This is my second and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine every night, which is about 6 to 8 months of the year as I sleep with my cats for half the night until they settle down and then return to my own bed. My first bags zipper wore out after almost 20 years of use. I still use it should the nights get too cold in my own bed when the power is out, so it is not getting thrown out. For the price, you can't beat it for quality and comfort. It took a while to find this online as the first I had bought from Costco. Now, I'm happy again, thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Capixaba

customer_reviews.title: ITS ARMY GREEN ON LT. GREEN/ NOT TAN AND CREAM INSIDE
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this cream/tan colored sleeping bag. As I was using it to upgrade my tired rocker recliner chair. It arrived as Army green canvas/green flannel. I am SO disappointed!! I had to order another $20 cream colored blanket to hopefully cover it up, because it is so ugly (at least in my maroon, cream and pink room) Also one of the metal parts to the zipper fell right off upon opening and I will need to get pliers to put back on and cinch together. But on the positive side, it arrived Very fast and is a good thickness and soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Angeli

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and very warm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag (new) at a flea market and liked it so much that I bought a second one on Amazon for my husband. I think it is worth the price because it is very warm. It is heavy and bulky, though. Zipper is excellent. I can zip the two bags together if I want. Kept us toasty on a recent campout when the night got very cold. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these sleeping bags. They are the best cold weather bags made. Bags are large and warm, the duck canvas exterior is like a Carhartt jacket. Flannel interior lining is nice. I've slept in one of these in a tent at 25 degrees Fahrenheit and stayed toasty warm. No doubt it is fine to at least five degrees. You won't regret buying one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, comfortable, warm and nice feel on the skin
customer_reviews.text: We really like these bags. They are very comfortable, the fabric doesn't catch your skin, which I really hate, and they are warm down into the 30's. We haven't used them yet colder than right around freezing but I'll bet we could go into the mid-20's and still be warm. We like these bags so much we bought four. when they are less than sixty bucks, as they sometimes are here on Amazon, they are the best value in camping bags I've ever used. If there is a drawback to this bag it is the bulk. But, the bulk is what gives this bag it's warmth and it is an easy trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these and zip them together. The sleeping bag is warm, comfortable and roomy. It’s fabric can feel a bit damp from condensation that happens while camping. It’s bulky so it’s great for camping out of your car but not for backpackers. We bought 2 more and gave as gifts to our kids and they love the bags too.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: More junk
customer_reviews.text: No more coleman. I went through three bags to try and get two the same size. They were all different lengths, shorter than advertized and non of the zipper lengths were the same. zippers wouldnt stay closed and i doubt it would keep you warm at five deg below. Im done with anything coleman, its not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman44mag

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: If you want just a warm bag, this bag is good. As far as customer support, price, size and storage features this is the worst bag. It doesn’t come with a carry case and takes up a lot of space. I contacted customer support before purchasing and still no response. I bought a Teton sports XXL zero degrees bag and it’s definitely worth it (better price, size, customer support and life tome warranty)
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: The zipper works easily and does not hang up on the zipper flap
customer_reviews.text: Big and very comfy. A recent spring camping trip to the Sierra Nevada mountains in California was COLD.... I use this bag in a pop-up style truck camper that has no heater. It got down to 25 degrees one morning and 28 another morning INSIDE the camper. I was toasty warm both nights. This bag is sufficiently long and WIDE to provide ample move around space. The zipper works easily and does not hang up on the zipper flap. I won't be rolling up this bag, as it will live in the cabover sleeping area of the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is the nicest, coziest, and roomiest one I've ever bought.....and I've been sleeping in sleeping bags every night since 1990! It's made of durable canvas outer layer, with padded flannel inner layer. The zipper works perfectly, and even without the zipper zipped......just laying the flap across your body -- you still stay warm and comfortable. It's very wear resistant.......made from good materials. I couldn't recommend this sleeping bag more highly!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Donlan

customer_reviews.title: Great oversized warm sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for almost a year now and have used it on several occasions. I like the size - I'm almost 300lbs and this bag gives me room to move around a bit. It is comfortable with the cotton flannel lining. It is warm - I always take plenty of bags and blankets when camping in cold weather, so I've never really put it to the test alone, but it has never left me wishing for more bag. It rolls up easily without having to fold it in half. The oversized cover leaves plenty of room for a loose roll.
customer_reviews.author: Human Bean

customer_reviews.title: Do not fold to wrap it up
customer_reviews.text: 3 tries, multiple youtube searches, and a then a different reviewer saying you don't fold this bag to roll this bag into the built in cover... I am finally at peace with this product if the product had come wrapped the way in which we were supposed to roll it, this would not have been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: PopsLFC

customer_reviews.title: Just l.like I Remember
customer_reviews.text: Soft Warm Thick cozy.... I hate running the heater at night, this thing is perfect on these chilly nights Open it up and cover your bed walla warm all night... its heavy I have 2 one on the bed one still zipped on my feet for the weight... and warmer feet
customer_reviews.author: I buy to much

customer_reviews.title: Big and warm
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, so we could zip them together, we like the fact that the material is soft on the inside, love that. We like to tent it. We all so have a large queen mattress and it fits perfectly on the bed. It is not water resistant. We had a small leak in the tent and the bags were wet. If you use it in other way it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Just finally used this weekend. These are WELL WORTH THE MONEY. Very soft, and amazingly warm. Big and roomy so you don't feel smothered. Not ideal for backpacking as they are big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: The Madd Hadder

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought a couple of these for our first sleeping bags. Overall we thought they were great! Pros: Comfortable. Can zip together for a queen size sleeping bag. Comes with small pillow. Thick padding. Cons: Large when rolled up (no good for backpacking). I dont know the weight, but it is heavier than i expected. We like this sleeping bag. We drive to our campsites, so this sleeping bag works well. We thought it was very comfortable. When we went camping it was about 50-60°, and it kept us very warm. I will try to post again when we camp in colder weather.
customer_reviews.author: JStan

customer_reviews.title: A big comfortable warm sleeping bag ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a big, heavy, warm sleeping bag. Great for sleeping on rocky ground, or for throwing down in the den when you have a house full of company. Not for backpacking, but otherwise a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Don Christensen

customer_reviews.title: The good: roomy enough for a 6 ft tall
customer_reviews.text: The good: roomy enough for a 6 ft tall, 260 lb guy to move around in and be comfortable. The attached carry wrap and handle are very useful - wish my old Coleman bag had them. The negative (commented on in other reviews) - No Way good to -5 degrees. Slept 2 nights in an unheated tent cabin in Yosemite - first night 24 degrees in the tent - Cold - wearing socks and long johns - still had to add the blankets they
customer_reviews.author: raintoday

customer_reviews.title: Zzzzzzzzzzzz......
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy, not obese, but big like a football player so I need room to sleep in and this bag does the trick but to do it it also takes up a lot of space in the truck when you're loading it up, that's the only reason I didn't give it 5 Stars, they should have used a micro fill or something so it collapsed more when not in use. But it kept me warm by the ocean on foggy summer nights in Northern California and it wasn't too warm it normal summer nights. I also liked the flannel inside, hate the ones that have the shiny cold polyester lining.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 4 years ago. Keep you warm in winter, cool in summer even in high humidity. These are holding up great. No problems with the zippers. Wash well, take a little bit to dry them but they are canvas. I highly recommend these and would definitely buy them again. Fyi these are not lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Tried several other ways to make his bed more comfortable but he constantly moved around looking for a more ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for odd reason: the back seat of my Mustang. That's where Jake the Lab rides. Tried several other ways to make his bed more comfortable but he constantly moved around looking for a more comfortable location. I placed a couple of pillows in the low areas of the rear seats and this over the top (won't slide around on the leather seats now). Jake likes it and recommends it for both long and short trips.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Abshier

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good sleeping bag. I do not camp but wanted a good one for winter safety in the car when traveling in the cold weather states in winter. It will always be in the back of my car when traveling. It seems very durable but the pillow is a joke. To roll up start from the bottom and roll tight. The top end has a hood(?) you can tie up and this is also the cover for the rolled bag. There will even be a carrying handle in the middle of the roll. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: the quiet one

customer_reviews.title: warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Chicago while that stupid polar vortex thing. I tell what keep me warm so you can compare. I have 1 thin sheet, 1 flannel sheet, 1 down sheet, and a comforter, total of 4 layers. Even so, sometimes I shiver. With this bag, I have to come out of the bag in order for me not to sweat. It's extremely comfortable. I'm considering throwing away my mattress to sleep on the floor with this. Best zipper I have seen. It never get caught while zipping. It's so smooth that I open my bag by holding the edge without worrying that it will get stuck somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anh P. Nguyen, MD

customer_reviews.title: Big and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable sleeping bag, big and roomy and warm. Have only used it down to 60°F, but I was as snug as a bug in a rug with plenty of room to room to roll over when I wanted to. I'd give it 5 stars but it rolls up just as big as it rolls out. It takes up a lot of room. Okay for car or horse camping but not for backpacking! Its footprint is probably bigger than most backpacking tents. It serves it's purpose for me and I'm happy with its size and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Call Me Interested

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very large and warm. Also very heavy. I don't mind but you wouldn't want to carry it further than into the cabin. It works perfectly for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: davidpnola

customer_reviews.title: This is a right hand only bag!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this because it has the zipper on the right hand side, not the left hand side as shown. I need a left hand bag in for the sleeping position in my RV. I couldn't just flip it as with other bags I've had because there is a 4' long piece of canvas sewn to the back which is used to roll the bag back - it would end up on top the bag and since it is heavy and coarse material that is very uncomfortable and awkward. Because of this I returned it, but it seemed like a pretty good bag otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm, Long, and Toasty!
customer_reviews.text: As a minimalist, I decided to ditch my bed and go with a Coleman. It is just the right length and very warm. I love the sturdy two-way zipper that is virtually snag-proof. It seals you in nice and snug. I also purchased an Everlast exercise mat to use underneath and it's awesome. The only down-side is the lame pillow that they include with it. It is so small and utterly useless in my opinion, unless you can use it as an "under the neck" support pillow with a real pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T Shields

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: So cozy! This is the favorite car-camping/base camp bag we have, though it gets used as a pad underneath my partner and I except when its really cold, because it's a lot of insulation. The flap/wrap thing that suggest it were to contain the bag when rolled is silly: ill fitted and positioned, but it's only basted on the edge of the bag as to say, "tear here". It was easily removed, and now the bag is perfect and mated well with my other Coleman stag print bag... and the canvas flap makes a decent bench cover or camp rag too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob T

customer_reviews.title: sleeping bag great but........
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is exactly what I wanted. Cotton and durable. When I opened up the bag after removing it from the box, there were several multicolored threads and a long black hair on top. Hopefully that is from manufacturing and I did not get a returned sleeping bag. There was a crumpled paper inside too. The bag otherwise looks clean and does not smell. It is well made and the flannel lining is soft. Trying to find a cotton sleeping bag with flannel lining is next to impossible. Just not sure about the threads and hair......
customer_reviews.author: M. Garneau

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleeping over.
customer_reviews.text: Great for what I got it for, sleeping over at friends houses on the floor. Roomy and soft. Pillow isn't great, but that was expected. I would never take it camping, though, because for one it is quite heavy so hiking it in and out of camp would be awful, and secondly because it does not feel water proof at all (though I haven't tested) and I feel like I'd wake up with all the morning dew soaked into my bag, tent or no tent.
customer_reviews.author: KitCat

customer_reviews.title: it was great. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace one I had for years. Went on a girls weekend trip and needed it for the cabins. It was warm and comfy. The only draw back was getting rolled back the way it was when it came out of the box. It was interesting getting it home on a motorcycle. I wish Coleman would have provided instructions on the proper way to fold it. I may need to buy a smaller one that can be folded in half and then rolled so it is easier to fit on the motorcycle. Other than that, it was great. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KyleAnn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to replace a sleeping bag she's had for a long time. This thing is awesome! I tried it once and couldn't believe how warm and comfortable it was. After that we had to order another one because we'd battle over who got the nice one and we couldn't quite both fit inside the one. It's great to just nap on top of as well. A bit on the heavy side for backpacking, but perfect for horseback camping trips (especially in higher altitudes where even summer nights can dip below freezing).
customer_reviews.author: Maximus_Manimal

customer_reviews.title: Super long, super warm and super comfy
customer_reviews.text: What a great sleeping bag! It's very very long. I'm 6 feet tall and I can get in completely covering my head and still have room. It's also quite wide. Two people could sleep in it, but it would be a little cosy haha. I slept in it in the middle of winter in my car and was never cold at all. In warmer weather I just unzip it and use it sort of like a throw/blanket. Oh and the zipper is fantastic! Rarely catches on the fabric, it's large and seems to be made out of tough plastic. It should last a long time. it's also Red, so you can quickly find it!
customer_reviews.author: TheGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, temperature was in mid to upper 30's
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, temperature was in mid to upper 30's. I was chilled a bit from the ground side, warm on top. Had 2 sleeping bags opened up under me for isolation, added a quilt the second night, that helped a lot. No cot or air mattress. next time will add a cot and see how that does. Bag is thick and does what it says it will do. Would have frozen without it. Probably too warm a bag for spring camping. I went in November, but you can always just lay on top of it, as it unzips all the way. Rather it be too warm than not warm enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Material is very nice. Thick
customer_reviews.text: Material is very nice. Thick. I mostly use it at a deer lease scenario so it's indoors most of the time. 1 year into owning it the zipper separated from the sleeping bag. Not a huge deal to resow but it is annoying. And for $100 I expected more. Pillow was laughable. But small pillows annoy me. Given the chance, I'd buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great sleaping bag for cold nights.
customer_reviews.text: I love that fact that this isn't one of those newer bags that slide all over the place or feel cold when you first slide in. I probably wouldn't use it as low as it is rated but loved how big it is. The only thing I don't like is the flap when rolled up. It is made to roll up without folding first which makes it very long. I fold it anyways and will be getting a stuff sack for it so not a big deal. May even cut the flap off and just use some straps.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlenburg

customer_reviews.title: Fits just right
customer_reviews.text: We put this in our camper as a bottom layer over the crappy mattress in there. We had a standard size one before but it was too small. This is working out great. I went this route instead of a mattress pad so we'd have the option to use it as an actual sleeping bag in our tent too. It's not that cold here in central Florida so I don't know if it would keep warm enough for harsher conditions but it's working great for us.
customer_reviews.author: JenLivingLife

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable, but poor sun resistance.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable. We bought two and love the cotton interior. So much more comfortable than nylon. Major fading/color change after only three days in tent. Pillows are so small they are completely useless. Sewn in wrapper shell took a bit to figure out... they store long and narrow rather than folded over and rolled like other bags.
customer_reviews.author: Will M.

customer_reviews.title: Warm, quality, and COLEMAN.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and warm, thick sleeping bags. Perfect for camping. It has a built in flap and ties that for the life of me I cannot get to fasten in a way that holds the roll tight. I ended up getting clips to roll them up and fasten around the bag. I always love how you can trust coleman products to be what you expect and not some "hey, this looks warm but I freeze my butt off" type of creation.
customer_reviews.author: L. McNerneyTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable bag
customer_reviews.text: Very cozy bag. Lining seems weak like it will tear any day now. Filing is polyester despite being advertised as cotton.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: A roomy sleeping bag??
customer_reviews.text: I move around a lot due to bad shoulders and this bag is perfect for those that enjoy plenty of elbow room and the added attraction of staying warm in 5 degree weather. I never liked the slick fabrics on most bags so the cotton duck on the outside is great for laying on in the summer. The construction was excellent and the zipper actually worked. It's great for car or base camping but not backpacking. The only problem is that my wife wants one now! But, that's good because you can zip them both together. Nice. I've recommended this to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag is awesome. The flap that is supposed to roll the bag up into is an absolute joke. What are you thinking coleman?? Are you kidding?? Cut it off into strips to tie the bag up after rolling it up. Totally stupid design. Other than that its a good bag
customer_reviews.author: joe richman

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Cozy
customer_reviews.text: I am 6-2 and it fit basically over my head easy (maybe 2 inches over my head). Took me awhile to figure out how to wrap the thing since it attached to the bag vs. a separate bag to stuff it in so you had a wrap it a certain way (there were no instructions on the best way so I had to wing it since there were no pictures on the box showing how it wraps). It's easy of course once you figure it out but then again I haven't had a sleeping bag in like 20 years so maybe this is normal I dunno. Overall worth it and happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Impulse6

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fall bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag for mild to cooler weather. Slept 8 days in mine with temps down to 30f. Comfortable all night. The filling stays put and flat.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: I also like the fact that it folds back up so easily ...
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is so thick and luxurious. The flannel is soft, thick, and doesn't pill. The extra large size makes it so much easier to turn around/over in the bag. I also like the fact that it folds back up so easily and has the attached strings and a ready made bag to stow it in. It is definitely warm enough for the weather in the areas where I camp. I am sure a backpacker would not want something this big though.
customer_reviews.author: Lura

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I drive a truck and it's 11° outside and my truck heater stopped working. Inside of truck was like an icebox. I did not know this until I climbed out of my sleeping bag! I stayed toasty warm inside the bag. Love this sleeping bad
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Huge, warm and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: These sleepy bags are great! They are huge and so warm. You could fit two adults in one if you wanted to. I love them for certain things but they are NOT for hiking or pack packing. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the way sleeping bags should be
customer_reviews.text: I have been a camper my entire life. and as a kid i would bring my thick cotton sleeping bag to camp. I went into stores however and all i saw was flimsy nylon and thin narrow coffin styles. blasphemy i say! this is a mans bag, its large, its comfortable, and as long as your not hiking for months its completely portable. i was glad to find this bag, and proudly now have a few ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Kiya Dowley

customer_reviews.title: I Absolutely LOVE this! And, it is great to get two and put them together! The warmth and loft is amazing! GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: This is big.. and bulky.. but it has given me the warmest nicest sleep while camping that I have not had for a VERY long time! The cusion and loft keeps you warm and prevents you from being attacked by rocks underneath your tent! I LOVE this sleeping bag! Buy 2 so you can sleep in it with your significant other! It is wonderful and I highly recommend it! Plus, it was cheaper than any physical store I could find (Walmart!)
customer_reviews.author: Tonya M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping Bag!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag!! I am 6'2" and 240lbs so I wanted a durable sleeping bag that had some room to move in. Colemans big and tall is awesome!!! Great for bigger guys. Plenty of room and very soft inside. Special zipper so it doesn't catch fabric. Extremely happy with this purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Starrett

customer_reviews.title: Extra big soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: Big, soft, warm, cozy - going to be warm this winter. True to description. This is a bag we use in our RV so it's not for backpacking. But it works great for comfort and warmth in an RV.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I have had a previous sleeping bag like this for years so it was time to get a new one and I am so glad I found it , same great quality as the old one I had.
customer_reviews.author: V. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: These bags have a cotton/canvas exterior which is perfect. We can sleep on top of them when ...
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our Hybrid camper as a mattress topper. We bought two and have them zipped together. We had another set of bags previously but they had a slick outer layer which made them slide around all night and a pain to use. These bags have a cotton/canvas exterior which is perfect. We can sleep on top of them when it's warm out. Or sleep in them when it's cold out.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ash

customer_reviews.title: need better help
customer_reviews.text: the pillow was not sone wall the way for that kind of money I want more quality
customer_reviews.author: Keith Edmands

customer_reviews.title: I like to sleep on my side with my leg stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! I like to sleep on my side with my leg stuck out and had plenty of room. I'm only 6ft tall but there was enough room in this bag for me to pull it all the way over my head and still not be able to touch the end with my feet. It only got into the upper 20s at night, on our trip so I can't speak for the -5 labeling, but there was frost on top of the bag every morning and I had to sleep in just my boxers to keep from sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On My Bed
customer_reviews.text: I love this in the winter on my bed.. I zip it open and crawl under for a worm nights sleep.. I love that it is large and my feet do not work their way out of it.,
customer_reviews.author: justgin

customer_reviews.title: Zip them together 😁
customer_reviews.text: I love how thick and warm these sleeping are. I bought two and zipped them together. Good quality. The only dislike is part of the zipper is plastic. How long will that last?
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ravert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal! We went camping in 30 degree weather and this kept the family warm in our tent. We bought two and thinking of another because they are such a quality and high performing product.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun A McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Great product, kept us warm in a trailer with no heat in -20 below northern weather, was fantastic and is so confortable.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Big, big sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6'1" 250+ lb son for a 4 week trip. He really liked it and continues to use it. One thing that's important to know is that this sleeping bag is HUGE. It doesn't pack down so you definitely can't hike or anything with it - - but for car camping or staying at a friend's house. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice big bag.
customer_reviews.text: Good bad, a bit bulky but that’s what you’d expect from a big bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice color, size, and features
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm, comes with a built in pillow, comes with a built in bag for storage and is a good manly color. When you double it over and roll it up so that it fits into its storage bag it is solid enough to use as a coffee table or foot rest.
customer_reviews.author: Hickabilly

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room inside, warm, soft, like my own bed.
customer_reviews.author: OLD2 K.

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag ever made
customer_reviews.text: Best sleeping bag ever made! I love it! This is my 2nd bag. I got one for xmas and I liked it so much I bought a second for my wife and actually since it has arrived about a month ago, we still have the 2 bags zipped together into 1 big bag on our bed over our other comforter. I guess we probably should put them away and save them for travel, but YOLO.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: but am not very pleased with Coleman's and their China outsourcing
customer_reviews.text: Something to be desired about Coleman's advertised sizing. The first one I returned, it measured about 73" x 33". The second one was a bit larger. It measured 77" x 35". Not even close to what's printed on the box. I kept it, but am not very pleased with Coleman's and their China outsourcing.. Maybe use it for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Over all it is a nice large bag for those of us who are a little wider or taller than "usual"
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sleeping bag for a taller person
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this for me for Christmas. I'm 6' 1" tall and about 210 pounds. Its is perfect for me with even some room to spare. Your average sleeping bag is too small for me. I always feel cramped and end up destroying the zipper because I thrash around at night. Great product. The pillow is terrible, but I expected that. Not the reason I bought it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Warm and spacious.
customer_reviews.text: Really really warm and spacious. Sometimes a little too warm for Southern CA, but it'll be great for cross country. You can always just bring a lighter sheet or blanket and then when it really cools off during the night, just pull this bad boy over your head and you'll be snug as a bug.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I am 6'5" and 300#. I haven't had a sleeping bag that I actually fit in, in years! I bought this because our Boy Scout Troop was going to be doing some winter camping. I'm not sure if the -5 degree rating is accurate, but it was down in the low 20's one night and I stayed nice and toasty. The second night it was in the single digits for temperature and my feet got cold, but the rest of my body was plenty warm. My biggest complaint about this bag is how big it is to roll up, but I'll get over it. This was a great purchase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Camping indoors with the three dogs
customer_reviews.text: This bag is everything I wanted it to be. Usually sleep with my bedroom window cracked open for fresh air effect and my bedroom gets pretty cold by sun up. I am toasty as a bug in a rug in this humumgous bag, usually leave it unzipped. My dogs do not punch out or tear the canvas outside a big plus. Not a packing bag to be sure but I can't wait to actually use it camping out in the tent and be able to zip it all the way up. Definately long and wide. Way to go Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Frates

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Cozy
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable to sleep in I am 6'4", 215lbs I like that this sleeping bag has extra room, I'm not a fan of the mummy bags they're too restricting for a guy my size. 2 bags zip together great and would fit a King size bed.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: sturdy heavy sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, my boyfriend wanted a heavy cotton bag. Well, these are what he wanted and what they said they were but they are really really heavy. I bought two so we could zip them together. I wouldn't buy again for myself, I would go for down or down alternative.
customer_reviews.author: S. Judith Morris

customer_reviews.title: It was fine for 40-50 F cool night
customer_reviews.text: Decent sleeping bag. I agree with other reviews, thought it'd be warmer. It was fine for 40-50 F cool night, and I think it'd be alright in 32 F temps, but not sure if you'd be that warm towards 0 F. Maybe. Wasn't too bad wrapping it up. though a bit bulky. It felt like good quality material and it was nice that it wasn't synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: WARM, HEAVY and COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: You literally need only 3 words to describe this sleeping bag. WARM, HEAVY and COMFORTABLE. The sleeping bag itself weights around 10 lbs and is not really portable. I mean it shouldn't be a problem if you just put it in your trunk and travel with it. But if you are planning on going on a camping trip where you need to park your car and walk a few miles, this might not be the best choice for you. After came back from our camping trip, my wife wanted to use it home. That's how warm and comfortable they are :)
customer_reviews.author: Traci S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my requirements...
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping bag. It's everything I was looking for. I wanted a bag that is very large, very warm, 100% cotton for both liner and cover, and still reasonably priced. This bag fits the bill on all counts. That the outer cover is heavy duty canvas is also a plus. Don't even think of using this bag for backpacking. It's much too heavy. But for a rugged, large, warm, very comfortable bag, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: And I love it. You cannot roll the bag down into ...
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is HUGE!! And I love it. You cannot roll the bag down into how it arrives and it isn't supposed to. You roll it up as it lies in the picture. It will take up more space for storage, but it is well worth it. I'm a fairly large person and this bag was able to fit myself and a lady pretty comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two of these and one was missing the pillow ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these and one was missing the pillow that comes with it and the stitching was coming loose. Contacted Coleman and sent them pictures of the issue. The didn't hesitate to send me a new one to correct the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: most comfortable bag i have ever owned. like sleeping in a cloud. its all i use now on my bed and of coarse for camping...it keeps you very warm. went on a fishing trip the first part of January temp was down to 12 Fahrenheit those 2 nights and i would have never known (except when i got out of bag to take a leak...LOL)
customer_reviews.author: Jim E.

customer_reviews.title: I love the quality and it's very comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: This is one heavy duty sleeping bag! I love the quality and it's very comfortable and warm. It is a large bag though and will not fit in your average washing machine. If you have a long hike to your campsite, this might not be the bag for you. It is heavy and it's not compact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not only was it super warm, but since we'd already brought regular-sized pillows
customer_reviews.text: This is really big and warm and comes with a little pillow. We bought 2 for a full-sized camp bed and unfolded them to have one on top of the mattress and the other on top as a comforter. Not only was it super warm, but since we'd already brought regular-sized pillows, these pillows were "throws" on top of the most luxurious camp bed I've ever seen. Ah, roughing it...:-)
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: Roomy
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' 4" and I have more than enough room in this bag. It is really warm (almost too warm). I will recommend this bag to anyone that needs space in their sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Thumper

customer_reviews.title: Very large roll.
customer_reviews.text: Great perfect warm soft awesome but huge when rolled up
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Montanye

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I've had
customer_reviews.text: Got these delivered just in time for our up north trip! Temps were below zero outside and I was sleeping on an air mattress in a basement! I'm 6'2 and had extra space after stretching out! Best bag I've had, comfortable and soft. Hard to reroll though, would suggest getting some bungee straps instead of their system. The pillow that comes with it, is kind of useless due to size but in a pinch may work. Everyone in my family has one of these now and they love em! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: driver24

customer_reviews.title: This is a Fine product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Fine product.... I'm over 6 ft. and the bag size fit me well, super comfortable and cozy. After just returning from a week in the high Sierras and some decidedly rough weather, I don't know about the low temp claims but I took my down bag as well as my therma-rest and felt well served.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gregg Waldo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the size and warmth of this bag
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the size and warmth of this bag. I bought two, so I can zip them together to create a queen-size sleeping bag for co-sleeping. The patented zipper is amazing. You won't get your zipper snagged with this bag. I'm going to get two more, for my children to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: R3n33dur

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag for cold weather, the only downside is that when its rolled up it is still very large, and hard to mount onto my backpack. It is a little heavy at around 6 pounds but it makes up for it in comfort and warmth, great for camping, but I wouldn't use it for long hikes
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect sleeping bag for a bigger person. The fabric is warm and feels good against your skin, not cold and slippery like some of those nylon bags. Haven't had it out where it is below zero, but 30 degrees was very comfortable. Excellent bag, and it arrived quickly and was just as advertised and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied in IN

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Large
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and large. Soft and warm. Was too big for us so we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Denice T.

customer_reviews.title: Big and bulky but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect. Not gonna be waterproof, but comfy and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: bought this for my husband for Christmas. It's exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband for Christmas. It's exactly what he wanted, and he loves it. It is very big and very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Martha J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used for a few seasons now. Sleeping bag is holding up well and is very warm to me. Several others in my camp bought the same bag. A lot of sleeping bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Miduckhunter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag for taller people
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag. I’m 6’ 5” and have plenty of room in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: James A Philen

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from camping. It down to 24F at night and I was nicely warm in this sleeping bag. I did have a fleece blanket around the neck, though, to keep out the wind, but this bag is warm, roomy, and works well. It's heavy, though, so if you're hiking before you camp, you may want to rethink.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wow, super big and super warm!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a blanket on my bed, and it is toasty warm, no two ways about it. It's hefty, zipper works great, it's roomy, and you can roll it up and fold it right into a carrying pouch that's attached to the sleeping bag itself, very convenient. Outside color is olive drab, and a pillow comes with it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron2BSure

product_meta.title: Coleman Sleeping-Bags Coleman Big Game Sleeping Bag
product_meta.description:
Sleep comfortably--even when the temperature dips below freezing--with the Coleman Big Game Big and Tall Adult Sleeping Bag. Long enough for people up to 6 feet 7 inches in height, this adult sleeping bag is designed to keep you warm in temperatures as low as 0 degrees Fahrenheit. The cotton canvas cover and cozy cotton flannel liner retain heat, so you feel warm from head to toe. For additional comfort, a Thermolock draft tube helps prevent heat from escaping through the zipper, and a ComfortCuff surrounds your face in soft, warm fabric. Fiberlock construction keeps the insulation from shifting, reducing cold spots and increasing durability. A two-way patented ZipPlow zipper system plows fabric away from the zipper to prevent snags and frustration. And the Roll Control design and Wrap 'N Roll integrated packing system make this backpacking sleeping bag easy to roll and pack. The Big Game Sleeping Bag is machine washable and comes with a matching flannel pillow.

AMAZON.COM
Stay snugly warm as you slumber on camping and hunting excursions with the Coleman Big Game sleeping bag, which is rated to temperatures as low as -5 degrees Fahrenheit. It's filled with five pounds of Holofill 808 insulation, which offers high-loft, hollow-core fibers that prevent body heat from escaping, thus holding more air inside the bag for good warmth. This super king-sized, rectangular sleeping bag measures 40 by 85 inches, and will fit most sleepers up to 6 foot, 7 inches. Other features include a heavy duty cotton cover material, cotton flannel liner, an included pillow, and Coleman's exclusive set of ComfortSmart sleeping bag technologies, including: 

 * ZipPlow: Prevents zipper snags by plowing fabric away from zipper 
 * FiberLock: Prevents insulation from shifting, increasing durability 
 * ThermoLock: Reduces heat loss through the zipper, keeping you warmer 
 * Zipper GlideTailoring: Allows smooth zipper operation around the corner 
 * Comfort Cuff: Surrounds your face with softness 
 * Roll Control: Locks bag in place for easier rolling 

 About Coleman
The Coleman Company has been creating and innovating products for recreational outdoor use since W.C. Coleman started selling gasoline-powered lanterns in 1900. Inventor of the hugely popular fold-up camp stove, Coleman developed a plastic liner for his galvanized steel coolers in 1957--the birth of the modern cooler--and the company has been improving their utility and design ever since. The array of products that bear the Coleman name now includes just about everything you might need to work or play outdoors, from tents and sleeping bags to boats, backpacks, and furniture.
feature_bullets: Adult sleeping bag for camping in temperatures as low as 0 degrees F
Big and tall design can accommodate most people up to 6 feet 7 inches tall
Warm cotton canvas cover, heat-locking flannel liner, and matching flannel pillow
ZipPlow system plows away fabric to prevent snagging during zipping
Backpacking sleeping bag features integrated packing system and is easy to roll
